choices.text: a consequence of immorality on the part of the wife. Several men agreed with this viewpoint. Reasons for divorce vary depending on the intention of the husband. Although a large percentage cited immorality as a reason for divorce, other reasons given include: incompatibility (lack of understanding), argument, debts, trust issues, lack of treatment, secretive habits and education, affluence, abusive relationship. One of the major reasons for divorce in Ghana is grounds for financial gain Legal cases regarding child custody are handled differently in Ghana by fathers and mothers. Immaculate gave three reasons for divorce in Ghana; first, the fathers are always involved with the children. Adjua tied it to the issue of dowry: ‘If you are the wife and your man is making arrangements for you to get delivered or knows that you are with child, he should be there by all means’. Ruth also linked it to the issue of child custody. She noted that, ‘because of divorce, the father will stay with the children and that is a way to get a free man’. Divorce also affects a mother’s child custody rights. Some fathers were mostly adamant when collecting their child maintenance from their ex-wives. Money assigned in the child custody payment of schooledand non-skooled children has drastically reduced. Bennie lost his HIV treatment based on inheritance as he was informed by his ex-wife’s family that he has no right to his father’s landed property. UCAM was negatively affected by the
